description: The command creates a new DNS zone.
availability: All users have access to this command.

paramaters.Definition: TTL value for the whole zone
Master nameserver of the zone; default = ns1.domain.com.
Responsible person (mailadress with "@" substituted by ".") for the zone; default = hostmaster.domain.com.
Value that indicates the "actuality" of the SOA-Record to other nameservers. The soaserial must be increased (or at least incremented) on every zoneupdate; default = 1
See the accordant RFC (listed below) for details; default = 86400
See the accordant RFC (listed below) for details; default = 7200
See the accordant RFC (listed below) for details; default = 360000
See the accordant RFC (listed below); default = 172800
A set of desired DNS records (A,NS,MX,PTR,AAAA,TXT)
Switch to enable extended mode to submit URL and email forwarding records
Create the zone as MASTER or SLAVE zone, default is MASTER
Master nameserver to replicate the zone from, only required if mode is SLAVE
Used to create a temporary DNS zone for incoming domain transfers, if no matching domain or PremiumDNS object exists
